qas.question: What does the term Appalachian refer to?

answers.text: several different regions associated with the mountain range

qas.question: What states comprise of the southern Appalachian mountains?

answers.text: Kentucky, Tennessee, Virginia, Maryland, West Virginia, and North Carolina

plausible_answers.text: several different regions associated with the mountain range

qas.question: What does the dissected plateau region refer to?

plausible_answers.text: Kentucky, Tennessee, Virginia, Maryland, West Virginia, and North Carolina

qas.question: Which southern states are not referred to in the more restrictive understanding of Appalachian?
The northern part of South Carolina is considered part of what limited definition?

plausible_answers.text: Pennsylvania, southern Ohio and parts of southern upstate New York

qas.question: What states are included when the region is extended to the west?

context: The term Appalachian refers to <a0_0><b2_0>several different regions associated with the mountain range<b2_0/><a0_0/>. Most broadly, it refers to the entire mountain range with its surrounding hills and the dissected plateau region. The term is often used more restrictively to refer to regions in the <b4_0>central and southern Appalachian Mountains<b4_0/>, usually including areas in the states of <a1_0><b3_0>Kentucky, Tennessee, Virginia, Maryland, West Virginia, and North Carolina<b3_0/><a1_0/>, as well as sometimes extending as far south as northern Alabama, Georgia and western South Carolina, and as far north as <b5_0>Pennsylvania, southern Ohio and parts of southern upstate New York<b5_0/>.
